pages.text: $(l:https://minecraft.curseforge.com/projects/waystones)Waystones$() is a mod offering an affordable and easy way to go from place to place using $(thing)Waystones$(), but they do not work between dimensions.$(br2)There are three ways to teleport to a waystone: by using another $(thing)Waystone$(), using a $(item)Return Scroll$() or $(item)Bound Scroll$() or using a $(item)Warp Stone$().

pages.title: Inter-Waystone Travel
pages.text: Teleporting between waystones is perhaps the easiest: go to a $(thing)Waystone$(), $(action)right-click$() it, and choose a target to teleport to.$(br2)Traveling this way is completely free and has no cooldown.

pages.title: Using Scrolls
pages.text: As a second method, you can craft yourself some $(item)Bound Scrolls$() and bind them to a $(thing)Waystone$(). By $(action)holding right-click$() with such scroll in your hand, you can go back to the waystone. This consumes the scroll. Alternatively, a $(item)Return Scroll$() can be used, which will teleport you to the nearest Waystone.

pages.title: Warp Stones
pages.text: For the most sustainable method, you can craft a $(item)Warp Stone$() instead, and use that to go to any $(thing)Waystone$() accessible to you. Using a $(item)Warp Stone$() is free but comes with a cooldown, as you have to wait 5 minutes in order to use $(italic)any$() $(item)Warp Stone$() again.
